alert.note: Alert for Allamakee; Clayton; Fayette; Winneshiek (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 17 at 12:58AM CDT until April 17 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Heavy Snow Band Continuing From Western Into Central Wisconsin... .The heaviest band of snow so far formed overnight, from north- central Wisconsin into parts of western Wisconsin, or roughly from Taylor County south into portions of La Crosse and Monroe Counties. Estimated snowfall rates are nearing 2 inches per hour with visibilities less than a mile being reported. Webcams are showing rapid accumulations occurring, with roads becoming snow covered rapidly after being plowed. In addition, the heavy, wet snow combined with gusty winds could cause some power outages and tree damage to occur. This heaviest band expected to remain over north-central Wisconsin into the morning hours. Snow reports from Sunday have been highly variable with a wide range. Amounts of a couple of inches have been common for parts of southeast Minnesota to as much as 10 inches across parts of western Wisconsin. As more snow falls overnight, storm totals could be a foot or more for portions of western Wisconsin. Travel tonight into Monday morning is expected to be impacted with a slower than normal morning commute possible. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Winneshiek, Allamakee, Fayette and Clayton Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511ia.org for road conditions.
